com.hotmail.kalebmarc.jtools

Class ConsoleFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hotmail.kalebmarc.jtools.ConsoleFrame

  • public class ConsoleFrame
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates a terminal-like frame for making console-based programs. The user can enter commands(or anything, really) and your program can do what it needs to depending on what commands the user enters. You can also output whatever text you want to the console. There's a couple advantages to using this over running console-based programs from a normal console
    • This comes with an easy way to clear the output text
    • The user can simply click on the executable .jar file, instead of running it from a terminal
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    cls(), getInput()
